Exaggeration: The claim exaggerates the impact of the tear-gassing incident by stating that all the vandalism in Richmond started because of it, when in fact, the vandalism had already started three days earlier.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that all the vandalism in Richmond can be traced back to the tear-gassing incident.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the tear-gassing incident was the sole cause of the vandalism, overlooking other factors or events that may have contributed to it.
Falters at times: The claim falters by attributing all the vandalism to the tear-gassing incident, ignoring the fact that there were other instances of vandalism and unrest prior to that incident.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations for the vandalism, such as underlying social tensions, opportunistic behavior, or other external factors that may have contributed to the unrest.
